{"step_by_step_thinking": "The mandible mostly ossifies via intramembranous ossification, with the exception of the condylar process which ossifies endochondrally, as stated in Document [13]. The coronoid process and the upper half of the ramus above the level of the mandibular foramen are not mentioned as undergoing ossification in cartilage in any of the provided documents.", "answer_choice": "B"}
